We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Microfinance

Summary


	The social media manager will be responsible for growing brand awareness, engaging our audience, and driving traffic and conversions across all major social platforms.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute social media strategies aligned with business and marketing goals
	Manage and maintain social media accounts (e.g., Instagram, Facebook)
	Create, curate, and schedule high-quality content (text, images, video, stories, reels)
	Monitor social media trends, tools, and best practices
	Engage with followers, respond to comments and messages in a timely manner
	Analyze performance metrics and prepare regular reports with insights and recommendations
	Manage social media advertising campaigns (if applicable)
	Handle online reputation management and community moderation.


Person Specification:


	NCE / ND, HND, BSc Degree
	2 - 3 years of Proven experience as a Social Media Manager or similar role
	Strong understanding of major social media platforms and algorithms
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	Basic knowledge of social media analytics and reporting
	Creative mindset with attention to detail
	Experience with paid social media advertising
	Basic graphic design or video editing skills (Canva, Adobe, CapCut, etc.).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;talentsearch@firstexcelsia.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Social Media Manager&rdquo; as the subject of the email.",

        FirstExcelsia is a firm of highly versatile and renowned Human Resources, Organisational Development and Management consultants with operations across several states in Nigeria. We have an in-depth understanding of the Nigerian business terrain and we are very passionate about partnering with indigenous organisations to develop glocalised HR solutions, processes and structures required to develop and effectively drive our clients' corporate strategies. The firm commenced operations in 2016 and currently has a team of consultants that have successfully managed numerous Organisational Development, Human Resources and Management Consulting projects in varying leadership capacities across all sectors of the Nigerian Economy.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Microfinance

Summary


	The social media manager will be responsible for growing brand awareness, engaging our audience, and driving traffic and conversions across all major social platforms.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute social media strategies aligned with business and marketing goals
	Manage and maintain social media accounts (e.g., Instagram, Facebook)
	Create, curate, and schedule high-quality content (text, images, video, stories, reels)
	Monitor social media trends, tools, and best practices
	Engage with followers, respond to comments and messages in a timely manner
	Analyze performance metrics and prepare regular reports with insights and recommendations
	Manage social media advertising campaigns (if applicable)
	Handle online reputation management and community moderation.


Person Specification:


	NCE / ND, HND, BSc Degree
	2 - 3 years of Proven experience as a Social Media Manager or similar role
	Strong understanding of major social media platforms and algorithms
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	Basic knowledge of social media analytics and reporting
	Creative mindset with attention to detail
	Experience with paid social media advertising
	Basic graphic design or video editing skills (Canva, Adobe, CapCut, etc.).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: talentsearch@firstexcelsia.com using “Social Media Manager” as the subject of the email.

Full Time Pharmacist Job at Castville Solutions




        
    

        
        Castville Solutions is a recruitment and business solutions provider specializing in the healthcare sector. We focus on connecting healthcare facilities with highly skilled professionals, enabling efficient operations, and driving business growth. Our services extend to recruitment, Templates for process and operations management, SOP development, and healthcare-specific training, with a clear mission to transform the healthcare workforce and operations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Full Time Pharmacist
Job Location: Alagbaka, Akure -  Ondo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a licensed, knowledgeable, and patient-focused Pharmacist to provide safe and effective medication management, patient counseling, and pharmaceutical care.
	The ideal candidate will ensure accurate dispensing of medications, promote health and wellness, and uphold regulatory compliance within the pharmacy.


Key Responsibilities


	Review and interpret prescriptions to ensure accuracy, legality, and suitability for patients
	Dispense prescription and OTC medications with proper labeling and instructions
	Counsel patients on drug usage, dosage, side effects, and possible drug interactions
	Maintain patient records and medication therapy documentation
	Collaborate with healthcare professionals to optimize patient outcomes


Required Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Pharmacy (B.Pharm) or Doctor of Pharmacy (Pharm.D)
	2-3 Years of Post NYSC Experience
	Valid Pharmacist License to practice in [Country/State]
	Strong understanding of pharmaceutical regulations and drug safety
	Excellent communication and patient counseling skills
	Ability to work with pharmacy management software and digital systems.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 monthly.

Job Position: Finance &amp; Accounts Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a Finance &amp; Accounts Officer to manage the day-to-day financial and accounting activities of the company.
	This role involves handling records, tracking income and expenses, supporting project finances, and ensuring proper financial reporting.
	You&rsquo;ll work closely with management to keep our finances accurate, organized, and up to date.


Key Responsibilities


	Record and track all financial transactions accurately
	Prepare invoices, receipts, and payment records
	Manage expenses and ensure proper documentation
	Support budgeting and cost tracking for projects
	Reconcile bank statements and cash records
	Monitor payments from clients and follow up when necessary
	Handle supplier payments and maintain vendor records
	Prepare basic financial reports for management
	Ensure compliance with internal financial processes


Requirements


	HND, or Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
	Practical experience in accounting or finance roles
	Good understanding of basic accounting principles
	Ability to use accounting software and spreadsheets
	Attention to detail and good record-keeping skills
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
	Integrity and confidentiality in handling financial information
	Experience in an engineering or project-based company is an advantage


What We Offer


	Salary Range N100,000 - N150,000 / month.
	Stable role in a growing engineering company
	Opportunity to work closely with management
	Supportive and professional work environment.


Method of Application&nbsp;

Finance & Accounts Officer Job at Ujax Engineering




        
    

        
        Ujax Engineering is an indigenous Engineering company in the business of Smart-building automation Services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance & Accounts Officer
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking for a Finance & Accounts Officer to manage the day-to-day financial and accounting activities of the company.
	This role involves handling records, tracking income and expenses, supporting project finances, and ensuring proper financial reporting.
	You’ll work closely with management to keep our finances accurate, organized, and up to date.


Key Responsibilities


	Record and track all financial transactions accurately
	Prepare invoices, receipts, and payment records
	Manage expenses and ensure proper documentation
	Support budgeting and cost tracking for projects
	Reconcile bank statements and cash records
	Monitor payments from clients and follow up when necessary
	Handle supplier payments and maintain vendor records
	Prepare basic financial reports for management
	Ensure compliance with internal financial processes


Requirements


	HND, or Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
	Practical experience in accounting or finance roles
	Good understanding of basic accounting principles
	Ability to use accounting software and spreadsheets
	Attention to detail and good record-keeping skills
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
	Integrity and confidentiality in handling financial information
	Experience in an engineering or project-based company is an advantage


What We Offer


	Salary Range N100,000 - N150,000 / month.
	Stable role in a growing engineering company
	Opportunity to work closely with management
	Supportive and professional work environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@ujax.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
